content.description:
This is fairly sketchy due to it being on the side of a very steep hill.  Luckily, it's good holds throughout. 

  Start low under the overhang. Work your way out on good holds. Top out left or right (right is easier, but you have to deal with the tree).
content.protection: SPOTTER! A crash pad would be good too.
content.location: To the left of Baladeo, on the other side of the tree.  It's the obvious overhanging part that juts out.

content.description: Start low on choosy flake--fun slab moves up high!
content.location: right behind sidewinder and climb-it change--look for the tall slab

content.description: Stand start on flake move straight up and top out.
content.location: Big white boulder to the right of the main trail

content.description: Start low in a ditch, climb out on jugs and traverse right on amazing crimps--top out on right side of boulder.
content.location: This is located over the hill from 'sidewinder' behind the giant slab.

content.description: Didn't seem like this had been climbed before--had to do a lot of cleaning/scrubbing and the rock was still crumbly. Will definitely clean up with time though.Start on low crimps, move up slopey arete and top out on the highest point
content.location: Right off the main trail, next to sidewinder.

content.description:
Sit start on good hold. Move up and right to a small crimp. Continue right to an awkward pinch. Move up left to another small crimp, hand/heel match right, and bump the left hand to a slightly better crimp.   

  The top out is sketchy. You're also on the side of a steep hill. 

  Video: 

Baladeo V10 FA from Andrew Minnick on Vimeo.
content.location: Around the corner from All at Sea

content.description:
Start on obvious rail. Make a move up to the right hand sidepull or straight up to the next rail. Make another move for the top. Heel hook and mantle over. 

  Located around the corner from Baladeo.
This area is just off (and sometimes right on) the main trail to get to the Lowers, White Wall, etc.  It sees traffic, but mostly from people hiking through.
